attributes.action: transport Ama Sumani back in to the United Kingdom and extend her visa to allow her to prolong her life through essential dialysis for her malignant myeloma that is not freely available nor affordable to her in her own country
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Ama Sumani is suffering from a malignant myeloma that would normally be treated with a bone marrow transplant. Ama did not qualify for such treatment in the UK. Further to this, on Wednesday, 9 January 2008 she was deported to Ghana because she did not qualify under the Border and Immigration Agency's "exceptional circumstances" provision.

Health care in Ghana is private and unaffordable to Ama; without essential treatment she will only have weeks to live.

Far from being abolished in 1965, this is a barbaric death sentence and must be reversed.

rejection.details: Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
